Detailed Description

Class to manage a simple virtual machine. Based upon hash and callbacks.

All callbacks must be allocated into the heap (using "new" operator). When deleted, the Interp does not free callbacks so that you must do it on your own to avoid memory leaks.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum uStreamLib::Interp::InterpError
 

Run method's return values.

Enumeration values:
BADCOMMAND  the command is not registred
PARAMPARSINGERROR  error while parsing parameters
WRONGPARAMCOUNT  the command was passed wrong parameters count
PERMISSIONDENIED  the command was disabled

int32 uStreamLib::Interp::run (  char *  name,
char *  param_string,
void *  context
) 
 

Execute the specified command. This method executes the command whose name is "name", passing the "param_string" parameters string to the command callback.

Parameters:
name command name.
param_string parameter string.
context an opaque pointer to the execution context of the commands.
Returns:
one of BADCOMMAND, PARAMPARSINGERROR, WRONGPARAMCOUNT, PERMISSIONDENIED or any int value a callback could return.

int32 uStreamLib::Interp::runScript (  char *  script,
uint32  size,
void *  context
) 
 

Execute a script. This method executes a command script contained into a buffer. The script can contain empty lines or # comments. They are ignored.

Parameters:
script null terminated string.
size size of the string.
context an opaque pointer to the execution context of the commands.
Returns:
one of BADCOMMAND, PARAMPARSINGERROR, WRONGPARAMCOUNT, PERMISSIONDENIED or any int value a callback could return.

void uStreamLib::Interp::setParamsCountCheck (  bool  flag  ) 
 

Enable or disable parameters count check. When executing a command, the interp can check if parameters count of the current command is compatible with the one registered into the commands table.

Parameters:
flag true or false to enable or disable this check.

void uStreamLib::Interp::sysHandler (  char *  cmd,
uint32  curline,
int32  ret,
void *  context
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Redefine this method to handle system return codes such as BADCOMMAND, PARAMPARSINGERROR and so on. This method is invoked by runFile() and is used to handle return codes.

Parameters:
cmd the executed command.
curline current line in the file.
ret value returned by current callback.
context execution context for this interp.
